title.narrative: ENGAGED CITIZENS

description.narrative: Citizen engagement is increased to support the realization of boys' and girls' rights., which contributes to Child Protection â€“ General, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, engaged citizens, including boys, girls and families, millennials, individual donors and private sector partners, are driving public action for the realization of children's rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Citizen engagement is increased to support the realization of boys? and girls? rights.

description.narrative: During the second year of the pandemic, UNICEF further expanded its social mobilization activities both online and through interpersonal communication to counter fake news and strengthen prevention behaviour. Organic reach on social media increased to 1.6 billion (2.7 billion including paid media), with more than 38 million people engaging with the messages. Another 3.5 million were reached and impacted in the Amazon and Semi-Arid regions and in Rio de Janeiro through a combination of inter-personal communication, a public awareness campaign co-designed with local youth in the Amazon, and social media outreach on prevention. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2022
